explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test method applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 86.3-88.2degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data), test temperature: 140degC).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 86.3-88.2degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >5,000mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (inhalation route) value of >6.52mg/L (4 hours), together with the absence of mortality (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on no evidence of irritation observed in rabbit skin irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of conjunctival injection with a score of 1 at 1 hour after instillation; 0.2 at 24 hours; the effects cleared up by 72 hours in all affected animals (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Not classified
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Maximization method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro assays (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests and DNA repair tests) and mouse in vivo micronucleus tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988, 2004)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on a judgment made by experts in the absence of existing classification, though some data are available on carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 2-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1988)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
Insufficient data available
In a rat inhalation study, one test animal exhibited accumulation of whitish foamy fluid in the trachea, and dark reddening and edematous changes of the lung.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 72 hours EbC50=0.0977mg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5.18 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.
